oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chemical stabilization of 1201-type Hg-Sr based cuprate superconductors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: BALAMURUGAN, S
GOPALAKRISHNAN, IK
YAKHMI, JV
SELVAM, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: hgba2ca2cu3o8+delta
150-k
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 1201-type Ba-free Hg-Sr based cuprate superconductors with nominal compositions of Hg1-xMoxSr2CuO4+delta (x = 0.1 - 0.25) were synthesized and characterized. The 1201-type structure was stabilized by partial substitution of Mo in the Hg site. A typical composition, Hg0.85Mo0.15Sr2CuO4+delta crystallizes in tetragonal structure with a = 3.769 Angstrom and c = 8.801 Angstrom and a superconducting transition of 57 K was measured.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 41st DAE Solid State Physics Symposium,KURUKSHETRA, INDIA,DEC 27-31, 1998
